intro: Corydalis rubrisepala subsp. zhuangiana, commonly known as the Zhuangiana Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or red flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and foliage, which are adapted to its specific habitat. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
